summary: The Community College Agriculture Advancement Act of 2025 aims to amend the National Agricultural Research, Extension, and Teaching Policy Act of 1977. It authorizes capacity-building grants for community colleges to expand workforce training, education, research, and outreach in agriculture and related fields. Grants are awarded competitively, with priority given to colleges coordinating with local industry. Funds can be used for equipment, faculty development, and apprenticeships. The bill also allows for the designation of Centers of Excellence and mandates an evaluation and report by the Secretary of Agriculture. It authorizes appropriations of $20 million per year from 2026-2031.
